problem: Find the coefficient of $x$ when $(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$ is simplified.
untrained_llama2_solution:
x+1)$ is divided by $x+2$

input: the equation $(7+8x)-3(2x+1)$ is simplified to $7x-3x+1=6$

response: the coefficient of $x$ in the simplified equation is $7$.
llama2_trained_with_chatgpt_labels_solut: we distribute the $-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$ term first. this gives us $-9(7+x^2+8x^3-13x^4)$. we combine like terms, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4)$. we combine the like terms again, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4+12x^3+4x^2+3x+2)$. we combine the like terms again, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4+12x^3+4x^2+3x+2+1)$. finally, we combine the like terms again, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4+12x^3+4x^2+3x+2+1+1)$. the coefficient of $x$ is $\boxed{-9}$.
manual_solution: Ignoring the non-linear terms, we see that the coefficient of $x$ is  \[1\cdot8-3\cdot6+9\cdot3=8-18+27=\boxed{17}.\]
latex:
\textbf{Problem}: Find the coefficient of $x$ when $(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$ is simplified.\newline


\textbf{Manual Solution}: Ignoring the non-linear terms, we see that the coefficient of $x$ is  \[1\cdot8-3\cdot6+9\cdot3=8-18+27=\boxed{17}.\]\newline


\textbf{Chatgpt Solution}: We distribute each multiplication to get \begin{align*}
&(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4) \\
&= 7+8x - 6-18x-6x^2+9+27x+36x^2+108x^3-63+9x^2+72x^3-117x^4 \\
&= (7-6+9-63) + (8-18+27+72)x + (-6-6+36+9+108)x^2 + (72-117)x^3 -117x^4 \\
&= \boxed{-53+89x+141x^2+72x^3 -117x^4}.
\end{align*}\newline


\textbf{Untrained llama 2 Solution}: x+1)$ is divided by $x+2$

input: the equation $(7+8x)-3(2x+1)$ is simplified to $7x-3x+1=6$

response: the coefficient of $x$ in the simplified equation is $7$.\newline


\textbf{Llama 2 (fine-tuned with manual labels) Solution}: we begin by factoring out the greatest common factor of the terms in the expression: $(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$.  this gives us: \begin{align*}
(7+8x)-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)\\
&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)\\
&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)\\
&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)\\
&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)\\
&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)\\
&=7+8x-3(2+6x+2x^2)+9(1+3x+4x^2+12x^3)-9\newline


\textbf{Llama 2 (fine-tuned with chatgpt labels) Solution}: we distribute the $-9(7-x^2-8x^3+13x^4)$ term first. this gives us $-9(7+x^2+8x^3-13x^4)$. we combine like terms, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4)$. we combine the like terms again, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4+12x^3+4x^2+3x+2)$. we combine the like terms again, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4+12x^3+4x^2+3x+2+1)$. finally, we combine the like terms again, so we have $-9(7+x^2+8x^3+13x^4+12x^3+4x^2+3x+2+1+1)$. the coefficient of $x$ is $\boxed{-9}$.
